title: FS/FT: Bradley Yellow Brown Printer's Scrap
author: Jobu

posts.post_title: FS/FT: Bradley Yellow Brown Printer's Scrap
posts.post_content:
$1100 shipped. Paypal FF.

Yellow color shift, missing several colors, possible small ink spill on the back. I added a pic of a normal Bradley for comparison. (I have a low-grade Bradley I can include too, though it is not the card pictured.) 

Will also consider trades (I like a lot of stuff) and cash & trade.

Gracias.

Aren't you looking for a e92 croft's candy red back as well??? 

:D
Ol Bill is still on the market.

i believe bill is from the same sheet as the chesbro.....it has the same remnants of either "glue" or something more than likely spilled on the scrap sheet over a hundred years ago!:eek:........these cards originated from the plank scrap find auctioned off at rea....I have the carrigan thanks to a fellow board member;)


great card bryan.....:)

[url]http://www.ebay.com/itm/1909-T206-Jack-Chesbro-printer-Error-Scrap-sgc-authentic-1-1-piedmont-Wetprint-/272132618016?hash=item3f5c5e3720:g:pDIAAOSwl9BWKmWM[/url]

Thanks Johnny! I recall the lot you mention but I don't think that I agree that Bradley and Happy Jack are from the same sheet. Several of the cards in that lot may have been from the same sheet as they have finished/nearly finished fronts, but Bradley looks to be missing a lot more of the ink passes.

great point!  I was looking for the lot before from rea and didn't find it yet......has that same "staining " and 150.......maybe printed at the same time????   :confused:   I have seen scraps with the same type of stain  really cool....
Very cool card.  A 1/1 scrap from the early T206 print run, unlike the more common y/b SC 460s you usually see floating around.
